g1vSvneS63LSYU1KVb0qoQ.text: Ok I've had the shawarma and the stuffed grape leaves (vegetarian). The Shawarma was excellent and the stuffed grape leaves were very tasty. So Will I be going back again you ask....NO! This place is only open M-F 11-5pm when most of us are at work. And don't even think about sneaking up on the weekends because they are closed on Sat & Sun. The only reason that I was able to enjoy anything from this place is that I took my birthday off from work and just so happened to walk-in and give this place a try. I'm thinking there may be a correlation between the business hours and the number of reviews. Anyhow if you are a student or work in Oakland do not miss this place! I however, will have to look elsewhere:(

1jz-sz2Z0uRd_tSp4REILw.text: One of my favorite lunch spots when I'm stranded in Oakland between classes. Lebanese-style falafel, which I prefer over other regional variations, and great platters -- I couldn't even finish mine. The guys working were really friendly, and had a long discussion with some other patrons who were trying to remember a particular Middle Eastern dish. They gave me extra pita bread for free. Not much in the way of ambiance, but a small, friendly, homey spot.

-iBkDix8LWhTHVXZt77hhw.text: AMAZING GYROS. The owners are the cutest people ever, they kept bringing us out food to try. I would go back just to hang out with them. Great fresh and authentic food! Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2T2ykVLmVAEMlgevBNZ0sg.text: Sooooo good! I got a combo plate with gyro meat, salad, tzatziki, hummus and pita. The combo plates will feed two people. All the employees were super friendly. Hummus is creamy and delicious. If I worked nearby I would go every day for lunch.

8_lkTPz33b_UrkJiKtc9HQ.text: I wandered into this hole-in-the-wall and ordered a gyro and kibbe.  This turned out to be way too much food given the very generous portions.  The food was solid - no frills but tasty.  The very friendly gentleman at the register likes to chat with the regulars.  He offered me extra pita to eat with my kibbe free of charge.  I don't find myself in Oakland often, but I would definitely consider a return visit when I am.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gyro and kibbe with extra pita (free)

Jh0tBrGKwoWZCw2XHK1r2w.text: Nellie is the proprietor of this unassuming little corner sandwich shop near all the UPMC hospital complexes in Oakland. She is the super nice Lebonese grandmother everyone wishes they could visit for Sunday night dinner.  The place has been around for 24 years and for good reason. To be honest this is my first time there despite seeing it regularly over the past couple of decades. Perhaps due to its pedestrian facade. Don't let the looks fool you. If you want fast luncheon style traditional Mediterranean food, this is the place to get great food at a great price. I had the kibbee and salad platter.  For $10.50, it came with 2 generous slices kibbee, a side of tangy hummus, large soft pita, and a salad with a giant hunk of feta for you to crumble on it. The salad was fresh and had included lettuce tomatoes onion mint Kalamata olives and a great vinaigrette. Nellie gave me great conversation free coffee and water and topped it off with a homemade Easter mamoul date cookie.  Like I said, it felt like I was eating at grandmas.  I'll be back for sure, and you should go there too

6Z1MdpMFnE-y2nUNc36yKw.text: I've worked 2 streets away from Nellie's for almost 3 years now - I didn't really know what it was until I googled a menu and the thought of gyro meat, some hummus and olives really hit what I was craving - I checked all the reviews and decided to give it a shot. I am so happy that I did - I got the #32 Gyro Meat, Hummus, Tabbouli, feta cheese and Olives - It was delicious - everything tasted fresh, it was a perfect combination and I got more than enough food for the price. I don't feel like I overate but I am definitely satisfied. I also had a chance to chat with the owners and they were so nice and welcoming - I will definitely go back for lunch in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. (32) GYROS, HUMMUS, TABBOULI, FETA CHEESE, OLIVES $11.00

Q9R0yftVgP7salkV5tcVjA.text: I walked down the hill from UPMC and came here for lunch one afternoon. I was curious and a sandwich sounded pretty good. I ordered the gyro because I saw reviews here on Yelp that said that they were great. In my opinion, it was okay. It was a little on the drier side and the bread was also kind of soggy. The service was fast and the owner was walking around in the shop talking to customers making sure everyone was enjoying things. So service is 5 stars, food is 4. I may come back in the future to try something different and see if their other options are any better.

qwcDp7JhRu3FZ6Xfe7aJ4Q.text: Disappointed. Poor excuse for a meal for the cost. No recourse had from the owner.  Very disinterested in willing to help.

TfB2ini7mRsTbK6Wb1vAHA.text: Food wise, I ordered the Shawarma sandwich. It was bigger than any other gyro or shawarma sandwiches in the Oakland area at about 10". The meat was decent, and I could definitely taste lively veggies inside. I liked the parsnips but thought there was too much tahini. It was also filling which made it a decent deal in Oakland for $7.22.  I liked how the cashier (I am presuming the owner) knew his regulars and was friendly. I didn't like the wait time for a shawarma sandwich. A twenty-plus minute wait for an item without unique ingredients at a place that wasn't busy is too long.  I'd rate Nellie' three and a half stars, but I cannot thereby I am rounding up to four because I think they offer the best value for Gyro and Shawarma sandwiches in Oakland.

fdaV5PsaMpSdxMf5EFGpOA.text: I wish there were an option for 2.5 stars.  I went back to Nellie's and it's OK, but I don't think it's A-OK.    I have an obsession w/ hummus.  I dont know what it is, but I'm guessing it's all the fat that is in the tahini that does it for me.  Sometimes the hummus at Nellie's is ok, but I'm spreading the word that (at least this week), the hummus at Nellie's is hummazing.  I hate myself a little for that pun but I get carried away by good hummus.  The hummus is good.  Because I've been to Nellie's three days in a row, I am now friends w/ the elderly gentleman who seems to own the place.  In fact yesterday, I got a kiss and a hug when I ordered my hummus!  I make friends VERY easily, and the same thing happens when I buy cheese at the Shadyside Mkt Dist so I think this is something I just bring out in people.  I dunno...I know I don't know him but if he keeps making that hummus we are going to be best friends!  Here is what I don't like about this restaurant:  1.  They dont really have lunch specials so if you get hummus and grape leaves as I did yesterday, it's $14 and that's a lot for lunch.  At least for me.  2.  there is no atmosphere.  This place has had the same wallpaper border since I started going there - ten years ago.  I think Nellie's has been in the same spot for at least 15 years.  3.  the place is kind of dirty.  My coat fell on the windowsill (i think it's the heater) and there was a line of gray dirt on my coat when I picked it up.  I don't think it has ever been cleaned.  The tables seem clean, but that is pretty gross.  Not so gross I won't be back, but gross enough I'm not sitting next to it the next time I go there.  They have good food at alright prices, and they're in a great location.  Try this place if you love greek/middle eastern food and it's convenient.  I wouldn't drive or go out of my way to eat here, but it's not bad.

yHqId7Xn1XoOIeejAyPiVQ.text: Enjoyed a good chicken  shawarma some baklava and some pumpkin ball stuffed with onion and walnuts served with Sriracha with a lemonade. Quite good food, if you can handle the gnats and crazy heat inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Looks good!

7Ph2t1o4EsQInrW3gj_6Nw.text: Came here after an appointment. It's small, cramped, and tables are a premium at lunch time.  When it's cold out, you're hit with the bluster if you sit nearest to the door.  The menu is on the wall, and inexpensive Middle Eastern cuisine. I got the falafel platter, and hubby got the gyro.  Food was served quickly and on styrofoam--so don't expect bells and whistles, just basic, good food.  It was hot, my falafel crisp on the outside and warm on the inside.  The tabbouleh was fresh and pita chewy.  The owner was a real sweetheart, joking with me and giving my husband a hard time.  I suspect he does so for all the women ;)  He was kind enough to come out and talk to us later, telling us about his family and his wife, who makes the baklava, which I had been currently eating. I always appreciate that approach from owners and I think it's great for business.  This place is pretty popular for those who work in Oakland, and I can see why.  Cheap, delicious, and friendly atmosphere.  Will definitely have my husband bring Nellie's home in the nearer future.

r8DOVZGkqAcbOetvfqeaEg.text: A little bit dingey but the food makes up for it. Gyros are amazing.

A27pVUs6OHu07daQnnzZhQ.text: Sorry but this is some of the worst middle eastern food I've ever had.  I had it catered once at a university event, then later I stopped to get a lunch to go and both times I was really disappointed.  Normally I love grape leaves but there's just don't taste right at all--the texture and flavor is just all off.  And the meat ones have some kind of mystery meat that seems like the quality of pet food.  I had a falafel sandwhich and it was just dry and bland without much in it.  It didn't come with a side or anything and when I ordered a small side of grape leaves the total came out to over $13 which is pretty pricey for this type of food even when it's good. The service was friendly and fast but doesn't make up for the awful food.  There also isn't much seating area and there is no atmosphere at all.  Just a few tables in a sparse setting.

XhMCjjXwuxgCrXDHw7dk_w.text: Inexpensive tasty option for lunch. Got a combo plate, the gyro (or shwarma?) was a bit dry but good salad, hummus, big slab of feta and yummy side of yogurt dressing. Pretty, pretty, pretty good.

KdFRgzUJb2WucQyi917Pmw.text: Nellie's has the best gyro sandwich around! The tabouli is also the best, with lots of fresh parsley and tomato and a nicely balanced sauce.  The vegetarian grape leaves are delicious (much better than the meat ones), with a nice lemony sauce.  Since I like their baba ganoush better than the hummus, I usually get the gyro combination plate with tabouli, feta, olives and substituting baba for the hummus. The staff is very friendly and warm and the service is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nellie&#39;s combination plate with gyro, cucumber sauce, the best tabouli anywhere, feta, olives and baba ganoush (instead of hummus)

KuUEu-JyFmWSicVMBQ7mGg.text: I'd never even seen this place until my boyfriend suggested we try it out last week. It's a small place, but it's cozy, and the man at the register greeted the regulars and was very sweet. However, the tables weren't the cleanest and some other customers couldn't find the sodas they wanted in the refrigerator.  My boyfriend ordered the shawarma sandwich, which he seemed to enjoy. I took a bite and it wasn't bad. I ordered the spanakopita. For $4.50, I got two pieces served on a few shreds of lettuce and a slice of tomato. I wasn't expecting the extra vegetables, so I enjoyed that touch. The spanakopita were pretty good. I didn't detect any cheese in it, which was fine by me but unexpected.  Overall, I loved the atmosphere of the place. The food wasn't bad. It's a bit out of my way, but it's somewhere I'll probably go back to.

mVPVi148ubw-v0RQFfPrBQ.text: Nellie's brings a much needed respite from regular ol' sandwiches, soups and pizza that pervade the Oakland lunch scene.   My recent favs are the falafel and tabouli. Oooh, that tabouli... so flavorful with the parsley and citrus, man it's good on a ripped pita section! Recent dislike is the hummos; I find it too "Earthy." The service is nice and typically prompt, they accept cards (there's a minimum charge amount), and the location is a plus for those of us who work at the top of the hill. Stop in, and give some local business owners your patronage!

6Bv8puCY_bLBtjbP-qseMg.text: I can't for the life of me remember who told me about this place, but I have to say, I wish they hadn't. I grabbed lunch here with a friend and though the guy working the counter was very friendly, the food was bland. I ordered some kind of pumpkin special which consisted of two tiny fried pumpkin balls (the dough was made out of pumpkin) stuffed with who knows what. With that you got a whole lot of runny humus and some kind of parsley salad (which made me a bit nauseous while eating it). All this came with a pita that could have easily come from Giant Eagle...last week.  With so many options in the Oakland area (think: Spice Island!), this was a total let down. I don't go over to eat here too often, so it was a shame that this was so disappointing.

Z4-S3lk6qJlw8QcnCqxUEg.text: MMmmmm Homemade goodness made from the hands of angels.    In love with the entire menu. Great home made arabic food for all those who feel the need for mommas cooking. The specials are great, menu is super and every time I'm traveling in from australia , Nellie's is always on my list of cafes and restaurants to eat at.   Hmmm, some of the comments and reviews below confuse the heck out of me. One of the comments mentions something about an obsession w hummus and that it wasn't good one particular day? If I had an obsession with hummus, Firstly I'd be making it myself and not having it from somebody else, and secondly, I would bring it to the stores attention.  Ah but what can I say everybody is entitled to their opinion.   Anyway I would love to comment on the remainder of these strange comments, but I need my hit of nellie's.. Yesterday!!

Za__ka6nfNXvr2BLGMEEfg.text: The Nellie's take out menu says "Homemade Good Tasty Middle Eastern Food" and that says it all. I ordered take out from Nellie's expecting it to be good because one of my co-workers recommended it. All this time I thought that Baba D's was the be all end all for Gyros in Oakland, but they definitely have competition from the lesser known Nellie's.  The feel of this little corner restaurant really is that of a homey, authentic kitchenette. If I had a Greek/Lebanese/MidEastern grandma, this is how I would imagine her food to taste. I am going back many more times to try their dishes, but for now I will recommend the Gyros, the Special of the day (it's Chicken and Beef rice, I forget what it's called), and the baklava was awesome. I had the grape leaves and they were good, not incredible. I will go back to try their Spanikopita, Meat Pie, Spinach Pie, and Falafel, not necessarily in that order. We'll see what my stomach desires each time.  The prices are fair - the combo platters are $8.50, their a la carte dishes are in the $4-6 range. They are only opened Monday through Fridays from 11am to 5pm. They advertise deliveries too, but I don't know the details.  All of us walk by, drive by, and see this place so many times without stopping in. Trust me, it's about time.... that is if you find a parking spot in Oakland. Good luck!

euPXJeT3pawLAdnMT-qGrA.text: The owner is very nice and he checked on me to make sure I liked my food.  The food tastes great, but I do wish I got a bit more food for the falafel platter based on price.  It's 11 before tax with only two falafel and small portions other various yummy things.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6HnWCGkdiNc_e8P2kJgnGQ.text: I had such high hopes for this place. I've passed it nearly every day for 2 years and thought "hmm home-cooked food, gotta try!" The fantasy was unfortunately not the reality.   We ordered togo. The menu seemed extensive and reasonably priced. I got the chicken Caesar sandwich. Not sure why it's called Caesar since the only thing Caesar about it was the romaine. The cucumber sauce was okay but watery. My chicken was in huge chunks and tasted bland. The pita was like eating a wet paper bag. I like a lot of strong flavors in my food and this was just not for me.

5z6pOq1cD4cTuEvnv3aH4w.text: Grilled chicken large chunks & very dry.  I ordered cucumber sauce as a side so glad I did without it I wouldn't have been able to eat the wrap. The salad was bland.  Pita was good!

YWjPgPdoygMhZ9QxldKXqw.text: Stopped by here today for their Oakland Restaurant Week special (which online says its $6 for any sandwich), except I paid full price for my gyro and didn't want to bother asking what was up because the owners were friendly and old and the establishment was packed for lunch. So for just a gyro itself, I paid around $8.50 including tax, which isn't horrible given that the food was super delicious but there are other places in Oakland where you can get a gyro, fries, and a drink for that price.  I ordered the gyro with everything on it, which was from what I could tell: onions, tomatoes, lettuce, hummus (or tzatziki sauce or maybe both)? Actually what ended up happening was that they mixed up mine and a different guy's order and I ended up eating a chicken shawarma gyro instead. I didn't protest and the guy behind the register insisted that it's "practically the same thing". I wasn't mad but that's also because I'm not a picky eater in the slightest. Also if there was a huge price difference between the two and I ended up paying more, I would probably be mad but I'm going to avoid looking. I think it would've been nice if he would've at least offered to make me what I ordered. The photo of the gyro that I snapped was a friend's that I ran into there.   The chicken shawarma gyro was delicious though. The veggies were really fresh. The sauce was SUPER delish and they give you a ton of meat. Besides the whole mix up with my order and not getting the restaurant week special price, everything else was super great. If you plan on coming here for lunch, I would recommend taking it to go because there is not much seating available.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gyro sandwich
Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken shawarma gyro to-go

NXK2oPNjzaytldgksgmJUQ.text: Best Lebanese food I've ever had! Te the grape leaves, the salad and the gyro you won't regret it

WwqoD3Wgia79QfNvgpbc3Q.text: Nom! What a gem! Nellie's is a delicious little middle eastern sandwich shop in Oakland on 5th close to the Kauffman building. I ordered the falafel wrap and the baba ghannouj.  The wrap was huge! There were 4 falafel balls covered with lettuce, tomatoes, pickle, and a tarter sauce. The balls were crispy on the outside and warm and smooth In the middle. Delicious!  The real star of the show was the baba ghannouj. It was creamy and smoky and went perfectly with the cucumbers and pita bread it comes with. As you can see, one order is enough for your whole crew.  I'll definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Baba ghannouj
Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Falafel wrap

kk3gqD4T_eEvSiTcBrOtUQ.text: This place is terrible. If there was zero, I would give it one but there isn't.  The decor is dreadful, the food is out dated and wrong and the place is dirty. It's horrid frankly.  Shawarma: their shawarma is NOT shwarma. It's barely a chicken sandwich. The chicken is old, likely frozen, with a clumsy jumble of tomato, lettuce and red onion. The garlic paste isn't even a paste, it's liquid.   Falafel: a little better, but it was cold and bland. It was with the same clumsy mess of vegetables.   On top of this you pay way more than either sandwich deserved.

d96rl0gJ5QvdmVCWTnB1MA.text: Just ordered a falaffel for takeout via phone, and was a bit late showing up to pick up.  The ingredients were home made and fresh, the sauce/tahini was not too thick, but correct amount of moistness to other contents.  Salad was newly produced and fresh.  Would have been better if falaffel was hot, but that is on me because I picked it up late, so it is more than likely impossible to judge...we will assume it would have been hot.  The fallafel was garlicky and crisply fried.  They add a sour pickle inside, which is how I like it!  Asked for and received some hot sauce to put on in to go cup.  All in all it is a legit middle eastern sandwich as expected.

uR_4BNZXTqWNI2SG_K5gNg.text: This place is truly dreadful.  The falafel appeared to be made out of bread crumbs and sadness, flavorless except for the hint of microwave radiation.  It disintegrated when touched, turning into tiny crumbs that hid among the other ingredients, presumably out of shame.  The rest of the sandwich was also objectively terrible, from the stale, chewy pita to the weird, inexplicable pickle.  The next time that I'm in the area and hungry, I'm going to eat out of the trash can out front instead.  It can't be any more disappointing, and it'll certainly be cheaper.

32N0AN2kDALlVG3lbIwLtg.text: This is a really nice hole-in-the-wall type of place that serves really good Mediterranean food at a reasonable price, and with friendly service to boot.   I came here for lunch and got a falafel sandwich. It was very tasty with a lot of a very tangy sauce, a touch of mint and some kind of pickle in addition to the falafel, lettuce and tomato. It was a good deal for a $7.50 sandwich.   The menu is large with a good selection of different sandwiches and platters.   The place is very small with a few tables. Not fancy at all, but just fine for a quick lunch.   You order at a counter and then your food will be delivered out to you. The gentlemen taking orders is very friendly in an old world type of way.   I'd definitely come here again.

4z4JO8PQ8Gethzphaxvrfg.text: Got the chicken platter. The tabouleh was good, but the chicken was really disappointing.. it was simply BOILED IN WATER! Instead of wonderful marinated, flavorful, grilled chicken the watery glops in my plate were very unappetizing. Hummus was too salty for me. Pita was soft and thin so thumbs up for that. Overall, will go back o my if no other place is open.   This is the McDonald's of middle eastern food.

6uNTJBIy0uhMUuR6Ea28Yg.text: I'm not much of a Greek food fan, but when a coworker was leaving to move to Australia and requested this be her last lunch, I went along.  I was pleasantly surprised with the flavor, and the value was good too. I think it's a great place to grab a lunch in Oakland.

fy4s_55xjegLr4P-_FmNIg.text: I went to try this today and I'm VERY disappointed in the meal I got. I got the lamb gyro and it was not good at all. The meat was thick, which I don't think that's how it's supposed to be, it was a weird grey color and it was season less. The pita was saggy and the sauce was pretty thick. Only came with lettuce and tomatoes, no cucumber. The owner and the people are really nice so 5 stars on the service. It was super expensive for just a gyro - definitely better and cheaper options in Oakland. Maybe I'd go again.

mNT2J_g3n01rArddEx43DA.text: Five stars for this little hole in the wall place! Very generous portions, prepared perfectly, super quick service. Gyro, chicken shawarma, and tabouleh were all delicious, the best tzatziki I've ever had, and perfect hummus. Don't pass this place up!

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tabouleh and hummus
Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken shawarma - pita not pictured
Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gyro - pita not pictured

L-OhYxUPdc5SKCspNRrSqw.text: I appreciated Lebanese/Mediterranean cuisine from an early age, having grown up in new castle, pa home to two phenomenal & authentic restaurants. Only going 50 miles south from there, I thought for sure the cuisine would be just as good, if not better in Pittsburgh! But then I would say the word "kibbee" and people would look at me funny!   There is a place in South Side that's good but I rarely head into that area. So I almost gave up hope.  That is, until I got a job in Oakland and turned to Yelp, I found an authentic and delicious little place that I've been to 3 times already. I can walk there. Any time, M-F. It's amazing.   So, Nellie's... as other reviewers have stated, isn't much in the way of "interesting" or "decorative" or any such adjective, really. What you see is exactly what you get. But they put the effort they saved on decor into their food. It is so flavorful. Fresh ingredients. Yum!   I am a huge falafal fan so that is what I have ordered every time and every time I am extremely happy. The only thing I will say is that the falafel and their house sauce is very tahini heavy! So this time I opted for the cucumber sauce and it helped to balance everything out.   I have also had one of their samplers including the hummus, grape leaves, and spanakopita and they were all perfection.  I don't think you can go wrong here, guys.

Sd18l-fmpTIB10Q6eklXag.text: This is another place that I've passed too many times without acknowledging! It's also located on the same corner as a popular bus stop so it's easy to not see it. But let me tell you how much I love this place and I've only been here twice. Now that I'm not eating meat, this is the perfect place for me, because there are so many options. My go-to option is #43 - Spinach Pie, Rice and Salad. The Spinach Pie is super flavorful and a decent size. The rice is also flavorful topped with almonds. And the salad, omigoodness the salad. Now, I'm not one to brag about salads, but the salad I've gotten from Nellie's is delicious. The vinaigrette is super tasty and I love how they give you a block of feta cheese for you to crumble yourself. And what I love about this place the most is that it's a family affair. There are family photos on the wall and you can identify those cooking and serving the food in the photos. Give this place a try, you won't regret it. Also, I'm planning to try this in the near future, but they also do catering and trays!

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach Pie, Greek Salad &amp; Rice

Xdi1N4WmqT-FSIQaBRJelA.text: I never write reviews but this place is nasty and rude. The storefront is directly behind a bus stop. When it's pouring freezing rain the owner goes out under the only little bit of covering that people have for shelter and smokes and blows the smoke in everyone's faces. Absolutely horrible disgusting behavior. Didn't wash his hands after. Gross.

5OjeRhWV0YO87lkVT4UX3g.text: A great no-frills, fast and fresh dining experience.  Service is prompt and the food is great!  I am not kidding when I say no-frills, though. Even if you eat in the shop they serve your food on styrofoam and give you plastic forks. Not super environmentally friendly, but it is what it is.  Vegetarians will find plenty to like on the menu. I personally had the platter with hummus, baba ganoush and tabouleh, and it was all spot on. They were very generous with the pita as well. At $10ish it was a little pricey given the ambience/atmosphere, but it was really solid food.  Will be returning the next time I need a quick lunch.

V0qNXy1OnZry27loL_0ksg.text: Such a cute shop with great potential, but the food was pure disappointment. I walk by this sandwich shop every week after class and it smells so delightful. However, the shop always seems kind of empty, despite being located at a prime location during lunch rush.   One day I decided to take the leap and order a chicken shawarma wrap from here. It's just a simple wrap, not much can go wrong right? Nope, it was so bland. There was no "shawarma" to my wrap. The wrap consisted of baked, unseasoned chicken breast with lettuce, onions, pickles and some chunky white sauce. Just look at the picture if you don't believe me (definitely not shawarma). The combo came with a dinky plate of fries and a can of soda. All that cost me $11.25. For a lunch special, it was quite expensive. There are better wraps elsewhere in Oakland for half the price.   I will probably not be coming back to this place because there are plenty of options walking distance away. If judging the food alone, Nellie's deserves a 1, but the service was great so I can't bear being too heartless. I had high hopes for this place and the owner is a total sweetheart, but the overall charm cannot mask the fact that the food here is mediocre and overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Nellie's Sandwiches & Deli - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No schwarma to my chicken

S5KQJVWhaRJ0pPI_Yl11yg.text: There was very little meat and the pita was chewy like cardboard. I'm never going back. I have been here years ago and it was great with large portions.
